data.title: Thirty-two line Latin poem in manuscript addressed to Cardinal Alessandro Farnese
data.meta_description: Described in The Library Chronicle of the Friends of the University of Pennsylvania Library XXVI (1961), p. 84, as "a thirty-two line Latin poem in manuscript addressed to Cardinal Alessandro Farnese" by the "enigmatic" M. Spi., author of the printed text to which this ms. has been added. The poem appears to honor (or at least to mention repeatedly) Pope Julius III (1487-1555; papacy 1550-1555), born Giovanni Maria Ciocchi del Monte. He succeeded Pope Paul III (1468-1549; papacy 1534-1549), also born Alessandro Farnese. The poem's dedicatee, Paul III's grandson Alessandro Cardinal Farnese, was a power broker in the conclave which elected Julius III as a compromise candidate. Established form: Farnese, Alessandro, ǂd 1520-1589 Established form: Julius ǂb III, ǂc Pope, ǂd 1487-1555 Established form: Paul ǂb III, ǂc Pope, ǂd 1468-1549 Penn Libraries call number: IC55 A100 552e All images from this book
data.text:
Described in The Library Chronicle of the Friends of the University of Pennsylvania Library XXVI (1961), p. 84, as "a thirty-two line Latin poem in manuscript addressed to Cardinal Alessandro Farnese" by the "enigmatic" M. Spi., author of the printed text to which this ms. has been added. The poem appears to honor (or at least to mention repeatedly) Pope Julius III (1487-1555; papacy 1550-1555), born Giovanni Maria Ciocchi del Monte. He succeeded Pope Paul III (1468-1549; papacy 1534-1549), also born Alessandro Farnese. The poem's dedicatee, Paul III's grandson Alessandro Cardinal Farnese, was a power broker in the conclave which elected Julius III as a compromise candidate.

Established form: Farnese, Alessandro, ǂd 1520-1589

Established form: Julius ǂb III, ǂc Pope, ǂd 1487-1555

Established form: Paul ǂb III, ǂc Pope, ǂd 1468-1549

Penn Libraries call number: IC55 A100 552e

All images from this book
